nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: A type of photosynthesis occurring in C3 plants, characterized by the fixation of CO2 into a three-carbon compound, 3-phosphoglycerate.

nodes.label: Crop Yield
nodes.description: The total production of crop biomass or grain, often measured in tons per hectare, influenced by photosynthesis efficiency.

nodes.label: CO2 Enrichment
nodes.description: The increase of atmospheric CO2 concentration, which can enhance photosynthesis and crop yields under controlled conditions.

nodes.label: Stomatal Conductance
nodes.description: The rate at which CO2 enters and water vapor exits through stomata, crucial for CO2 diffusion in leaves.

nodes.label: Membrane Permeability
nodes.description: The ability of cell membranes to allow the passage of gases such as CO2, affecting photosynthesis efficiency.

nodes.label: Leaf Anatomy
nodes.description: The structural composition of leaves, which can influence light capture and gas exchange, impacting photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Aquaporins
nodes.description: Water channel proteins that facilitate the movement of water and CO2 across cell membranes, enhancing mesophyll conductance.

nodes.label: Mesophyll Conductance
nodes.description: The ease with which CO2 diffuses from the intercellular air spaces into the chloroplasts, critical for efficient photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Rubisco
nodes.description: Ribulose-1,5-bisphosphate carboxylase/oxygenase, an enzyme that catalyzes the first step of carbon fixation in photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Rubisco Specificity
nodes.description: The preference of Rubisco for CO2 over O2, which affects the efficiency of photosynthesis and photorespiration.

nodes.label: Catalytic Turnover
nodes.description: The rate at which Rubisco catalyzes the conversion of substrate to product, influencing photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Photorespiration
nodes.description: A metabolic pathway that consumes O2 and releases CO2, reducing the efficiency of photosynthesis in C3 plants.

nodes.label: NADPH Consumption
nodes.description: The use of NADPH in metabolic processes, which can be reduced by engineering alternative pathways to improve photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Chloroplast CO2 Levels
nodes.description: The concentration of CO2 within chloroplasts, which can be elevated to enhance photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Genetic Engineering
nodes.description: Techniques used to modify the genetic makeup of organisms, aimed at improving traits such as photosynthesis in crops.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Efficiency
nodes.description: The effectiveness of photosynthesis in converting light energy into chemical energy, crucial for crop productivity.

nodes.label: Yield Potential
nodes.description: The maximum achievable yield of a crop under optimal conditions, influenced by photosynthesis and sink capacity.

nodes.label: C4 Plants
nodes.description: Plants that utilize a different photosynthetic pathway, known for higher efficiency in CO2 fixation compared to C3 plants.

nodes.label: Global Change
nodes.description: Changes in climate and environmental conditions that impact agricultural productivity and photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Crop Improvement
nodes.description: Strategies aimed at enhancing crop traits, including yield, disease resistance, and stress tolerance.
